alert.note: Alert for Upper Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 7:23AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM AKDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...Kuskokwim River at McGrath. * WHEN...Until 715 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Two ice jams has formed in the Kuskokwim River near the end of the runway, causing flooding that washed out the Dump Road and surrounded people by water that live in the upriver side of town. Flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 AM AKDT, trained weather spotters reported an ice jam on Kuskokwim near McGrath. Impounding water due to the ice jam will cause rapid river rises upstream. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Kuskokwim River at McGrath stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to the National Weather Service at 907-458-3700 or local law enforcement.
